FuncDef:
The peer advertise encap-type command configures the encapsulation attribute carried by EVPN routes.
The undo peer advertise encap-type command restores the default configuration.
By default, a device advertises EVPN routes that carry the MPLS encapsulation attribute to its peers.
CLIs: undo peer <ipv6-address> advertise encap-type { vxlan | srv6 }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the IPv4 address of a peer.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

Specifies EVPN routes carrying the VXLAN encapsulation attribute.
-

Specifies the IPv6 address of a peer.
The value is a 32-digit hexadecimal number, in the format of X:X:X:X:X:X:X:X.

Specifies EVPN routes carrying the SRv6 encapsulation attribute.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
By default, BGP EVPN peers advertise the EVPN routes carrying the MPLS encapsulation attribute to each other. To allow EVPN peers to advertise EVPN routes carrying the SRv6 encapsulation attribute to each other in EVPN VPWS over SRv6 scenarios, run the peer advertise encap-type srv6 command.
On a BGP EVPN, a device can advertise EVPN routes that carry the VXLAN or MPLS encapsulation attribute to its peers. To enable a device to advertise EVPN routes that carry the VXLAN encapsulation attribute to its peers in distributed or centralized VXLAN gateway scenarios, run the peer advertise encap-type vxlan command.
Precautions
When a BGP EVPN peer is in a peer group, the undo peer advertise encap-type command is run to restore the default encapsulation attributes.
